Nekopara Vol. 2 is a kinetic novel where all you do is just read through and there will be no choices to be made at all. Developed by NEKO WORKs  and published by Sekai Project. I honestly was a little surprised in the direction of the story went. What I was expecting was the story to be something similar to Nekopara vol. 1 where almost everything seems perfect and jut a few obstacles here and there but vol. 2 is different there are topics of family being touched on and there are a few moments where it gave me a heart attack.

reviewText:
Nekopara is back and Shigure is as weird as ever. Prepare to journey into the second volume of this kinetic novel series and submerge yourself in catgirls. The series maintains its high quality visuals, light animations, chibi art, Japanese-only voice acting, and adds some new effects to the mix. The Steam version will last only about 4+ hours because they put in a huge effort for the h-content side of things. On to other things!

StoryThe game continues Kashou’s story and revolves around the development of Azuki and Cononut as characters. Chocola and Vanilla are there in the beginning, but the game shifts its focus to the other two catgirls. I definitely enjoyed Kashou’s comedic role as the straight man with the jokes and misunderstandings. He’s not going through a rough patch like in Vol. 1, so he’s mostly adding to the comedy and relationships. A story isn’t very interesting without any conflicts, so you can expect our characters to face a couple obstacles along the way as they bake their way into happiness.

H-contentThe developer made it easier to acquire the erotic content for this game without having to go the two copies route, one on Steam and one on a website. People can go to the website (use Google) that sells an auto-patcher for $9.99 featuring over 2 hours of additional content if you leave it on auto-play (best way to keep the keyboard clean) and listen to all the voice work. The additional scenes are quite substantial and go full hentai with the shortest one being around 30 minutes. They use a mixture of stills, light animation (which can be turned off), and lewd sounds. They also made Kashou have a superhuman amount of “frosting” to give. The scenes seemed a little too long, but that just means that they’ll entertain others for quite a bit of time if the body is willing.

There are some things to consider before purchasing the patch. The scenes cause a bit of a tonal change, probably due to the length of them as the sensual frolicking did last for quite a while. The game goes from cute to very, very sticky. The writing also shifts into porn territory with the lewd version of “come” and its conjugations being used frequently. At one point, I saw “baby bakery” with “man-batter” being used in a single sentence. There are also slurping sounds. If you want to maintain a lighter, perverted mood, then the patch might not be the best idea. Stick with the Steam version instead or be prepared to see them in a different light. For example, I have a hard time remembering the plot because the game ended soon after an hour long lovemaking scene. I’m pretty sure it was a happy ending. Oho! Lastly, the h-content has mosaic censorship in place and please make sure to stay moisturized with a clean towel nearby while playing this game.

The BugIn my playthrough, for the whole experience, there was a frequently occuring auto-play bug that stopped the game from progressing until I clicked or pressed enter. This interrupted my relaxed state as I did prefer sitting back while reading what was happening. It went something… *click* like this. It never went away. I still see it in my sleep. Be warned! There were also a couple of weird graphical glitches happening with mouths closing and opening a bit too fast while speaking. They contributed to my impression that the game wasn’t as polished since auto-play is how I roll, but maybe other people will not have the same issue.
-
Nekopara Vol. 2 seems like a fine entry for the series. It double downs on the h-content if you want erotic shenanigans and has a proper story, unlike Vol. 0. As a reminder, this game isn’t a dating sim. There are no choices. It’s a kinetic novel. Have fun!

reviewText:
A serious review of Nekopara Vol.2 ? What is this an alternate universe or something ?!

Nekopara Vol.2 is a kinetic novel and as you can see from the title, this is a sequel for as you can guess it, Nekopara Vol.1. Soo, is this a good kinetic novel ? Is the intended purpose of this kinetic novel is achieved ? Should i buy it ? Its kinda hard to answer all that questions with a simple yes and no, soo i will tell you all about it in this long wall of text.

First thing first, the writing is kinda a mixed bag, the first, second, and third chapter is good if your expection for this kinetic novel is the same as the first one to get a giggle along with a cutenessgasm, you will not get a deep plot since that isn't the point of this kinetic novel. Its the charm of the first one and for the first 4 chapters, its the charm of it also. But it kinda fell apart after that, i don't know if it because of lazyness or lack of time, since the writing talent is there but unfortunately every new characters is only introduced and not explore further which is really sad since the introduction is good and solid. In this Vol.2 the introduction of the characters is like checking a check list before the novel get to other main part if you bought the adult version, the adult scene. The worse part is, the last 3 chapters is really short if you didn't count the adult scene. You can finished the chapter 7 in about 5 minutes, 5 minutes !! I can say i'm really dissapointed in it, since there's a lot more plot conflict and character development in Vol.1 than Vol.2 and it took 13 hours to finished Vol.1 compare to 6 hours in Vol.2. Vol.1 got me to care for the main characters, Chocola and Vanilla more than Vol.2 main characters, Coconut and Azuki. To get Chocola and Vanilla to be the protagonist catpanion took a couple conflict that get me to like them in the process, but in Vol.2 the main protagonist just have to be nice and horny a little, and there you go catpanion and the adult scene reward for the player.

The art and visual is one of the best in visual/kinetic novel game that i played. Since well, the characters is moving with the help of the E-mote system, just see the Vol.1 introduction trailer in Sekai Project channel if you want to see it in action. It makes the whole novel feel a lot more cuter and livelier than a normal kinetic novel which is really great. I wish all japanese visual novel use this system more than it currently is, but that's just my dream. The background of all scene is nicely drawn, i can't really complain about it that much. Again, if only more time being put in making the plot and character development, this could be a lot more fun experience.

Soo, Is this a great kinetic novel ? No, it lack deep plot and good conflict that a great kinetic novel has. Is this a good kinetic novel and serve its purpose ? Yes if you put your reading experience to get a fun and cute experiences, but it could be a much much much better. At this stage, it just a kinetic novel to fill your cutegasm and enjoy the adult scene, if you played the adult version. Am i recommending this novel ? Yes, only if you already try the first one and enjoy it. But you still will feel disappointed when you finished it, not because this is bad but because this could be a better one.

reviewText:
Playtime to 100%: About 4 hours
Keywords: visual novel, catgirls, slice-of-life, comedy, lewd

NEKOPARA Vol. 2's four-hour story follows the La Soleil gang as they manage the busy patisserie, where business is booming thanks to imouto Shigure knowing how to leverage the appeal of catgirls online. Protagonist (pervy) pastry chef Kashou has a chance to get closer to the other catgirls, particularly Coconut, the clumsy younger sister, and Azuki, the sarcastic older sister. There are fights, misunderstandings, and many, many tears, but ultimately love and affection will conquer all.

It's a sweet, heartwarming story, but it's also extremely predictable and follows the same basic pattern as Vol. 1. Most people probably don't play NEKOPARA for the plot, but if you're looking for something more than silly slice-of-life, then this isn't for you. I would have preferred a little more variation as I feel that the characters lose some of their individuality when their issues all essentially boil down to being head over heels for Master, but their personalities do shine through in their speech and interactions.

The production quality is as high as ever with gorgeous, vibrant artwork from Sayori-san. Every CG, SD, character sprite, and background is an absolute joy to look at although I unfortunately didn't notice any new backgrounds that we hadn't seen in Vol. 1.

The E-mote system is used to great effect to bring the character sprites to life, and the movements and facial expressions are perfectly matched with the speech. Vol. 2 also retains the chest bounciness" slider from Vol. 1 and the "petting" mode from Vol. 0

Having played Nekopara 0, 1 and 2, I can say that the latest game (2) is definitely not as tedious as the previous main game (1). Nekopara 0 is actually bonus content for game number 1 with an additional story line which I enjoyed even though it was rather short. While Nekopara 1 mainly focuses on Chocola and Vanilla, Nekopara 2 actively involves the other catgirls as well. I'm personally not such a big fan of the Chocola & Vanilla combination (I'm a girl after all), but I've come to identify with Coconut. Hence, I've been enjyoing the new approach and am really happy that I'm getting to see some more Coconut content (yay!).

Generally speaking, the story starts where Nekopara 1 ended, and the game has a strong focus on the relationships between the catgirls/and the main character (you). I think this is a very nice approach since it makes the characters more likeable. Additionally, the graphics have been updated and the characters appear even more real (Great!) while the interface hasn't really changed. It's still simple and available in at least 3 languages.

Positive:

+ Improved story line
+ more character attributes (characters feel real)
+ improved graphics/gestures/interaction
+ OK translation
+ NEW feature (as seen in Nekopara 0): pet your cats!

- story line may seem rather long (5 hours play time is a lot for a Visual Novel without choices)
- may not be suitable for girls due to sexual references

All in all, I consider myself an open person and would recommend this game for girls and guys interested in the series, and for the (lonely) player. But keep in mind that the steam version is censored and if you're expecting certain sexual content, you're wrong here.

reviewText:
It's a catgirl paradise! Again!

If you have read the previous VNs, you know what to expect. If you haven't read the Nekopara series before, this is the third VN to date. Vol 1 starts you off and focuses on the main catgirls: Chocola and Vanilla, Vol 0 is a prequel, giving you some backstory on all the characters and Vol 2 mainly focuses on Azuki and Coconut, two of the other catgirls. Reading them in order is recommended but not exactly required.

This is a kinetic novel (no choices or branching paths) that continues the rather cute story of yourself (a pastery shop owner), your catgirls, your sister and her catgirls all running the shop and it's presented along with Sayori's beautiful artwork. This game also uses the E-Mote System, a Live2D-like system of character animation that really brings the characters to life. Petting Mode also returns from Vol 0 allowing you pet anyone that appears in an E-Mote animated scene. Gotta pet them all! The production values are as high as you can expect.

Also note that unlike Vol 1, Vol 2 has an official patch for turning the all-ages Steam version into the R18 version. The patch restores all the content that was cut from the all-ages version. It does apply censoring if you take screenshots or stream but while reading and not streaming it is completely intact. The patch is available on Denpasoft if you search around.

The game length will depend on your reading speed, how often you take breaks to pet your catgirls and whether or not you bought the patch with it's added content but it should definately last about 6 hours or more. Well worth the $10 or $20 it costs.

reviewText: Nekopara vol. 2 is as dense and deep as the other two games in the series in terms of RPG mechanics, and the overwhelmingly massive open-world environment has at once made that depth more intimidating, and in the long run, more rewarding. It’s difficult to express just how huge and open this world is: verdant, rolling fields liberally dotted with swaying foliage of every shape and size fill the space between loosely connected, ramshackle townships where people struggle to scrape by. A full day/night cycle and dynamic weather pull it all together, cementing Nekopara vol. 2’s landscape as one of the most authentic-feeling open worlds I’ve ever seen. A handy minimap points you where you want to go, which might seem like a crutch, but honestly, without it, I’d have been hopelessly lost. That a world this size still feels so purposeful, and full of things to do is quite an achievement.\n\n10/10

You can now interact with the catgirls, just like in Nekopara Vol. 0, and there seem to be new facial expressions as well.
If you want the adult version, you may buy the adult patch from the official website for $10.

reviewText:
So kawaii ,,,^-^,,, Neko <3

Chest bounciness slider option back again? Even more cat girls in seifuku? This game deserves a 10/10.

In all honesty though, a sequel to one of the best animated VNs of all time. The amount of work Sayori put into this is just amazing. Character details and animations are brilliantly done for a VN. They even incorporated the game window into the game, moving the game in windowed mode moves the characters in the game.

A slightly short VN in comparison to others, story is well done but not the best, personally I believe the story could have been longer. There is only one path in the game, but it doesn't effect the game's entertainment at all. When Vol 3 is  released, I'm sure they'll incorporate possibly even more choices and an even larger story.

I'll give this VN a 10/10 though, voice acting is superb, the VN's entertainment was top notch, and the animation is out of the world. Not to mention, it continues the next chapter of the series and opens up for Vol 3.
